model

Class Rules

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Rules

  • public class Rules
extends java.lang.Object
    this class contains methods that calculate whether a game-termination condition (such as achieving a win or a draw) has been reached.
    Author:
    {}rpheus

      • isWin

        public static boolean isWin(Board board,
            java.lang.String token)
        this method checks to see if a win condition has been met
        Parameters:
        board - (an instance of the board to check for win conditions)
        token - (the player token of the active player)
        Returns:
        boolean (true iff win condition met)

      • isDraw

        public static boolean isDraw(Board board,
             java.lang.String token)
        this class checks to see if a draw has been reached
        Parameters:
        board - (instance of the board to check for stalemate)
        token - (the player token of the active player)
        Returns:
        boolean (true iff stalemate)

      • getThreeLength

        public static int[][] getThreeLength(int n)
        gets a particular 3-length between 0 and 7
        Parameters:
        n - integer between 0 and 7
        Returns:
        int[][] 2-D array representation of a -3length with the data pairs it holds being coordinate values.

      • oppositeToken

        public static java.lang.String oppositeToken(java.lang.String token)
        get the value of the opposing token to the one you pass in.
        Parameters:
        token -
        Returns:
        "X" if token=="O", "O" if token=="X"
